reviews.text: I finally had the opportunity to stay at this property in March for a long weekend. During this time the Pacific Life Tennis Open event was going on which I also attended. This property is five to eight minutes away depending on a bit of traffic but excellent location when attending that event. It was big and spacious and very overwhelming for one who had not seen it up close before, there are two entrances, one that seemed to lead directly to the front desk and valet and the other to the main lobby of the hotel. With so much activity going on, one needs to be sure on what they will need, if it's help with your bags or you want the valet to park your car, you may have to be assertive and ask as there current guests going in and out of there at the same time. Quite alot of hussle and bussle that is for sure. The inside lobby is spacious and well kept, with a coffee shop and other shops popping up, there is a grand staircase which leads down to the pool area and lower level lounge and open sports bar. Very impressive and nice to look at on a sunny day, the rooms are big and full of light, mine was overlooking the courtyard and of course it was a hoot to see the tennis stars coming and going, not to mention running into a few while walking around my floor, in the elevator and the coffee shop on the grounds (which was a personal favorite as they made this large chocolate sugar cookies, that were incredibly tasty...I had one every day I was there) Also, there was a cobb salad from the room service menu that was awesome as well! Let's not beat around the bush, prices are up there, but, hey you knew that right? since you will choose to stay at this property. No whining from the peanut gallery. Just have a good time, and the good time will come right back at ya!
reviews.title: "Quite a place"

reviews.text: The complex is large and at times a bit overwhelming, but we found our room on the sixth floor overlooking the gorgeous mountains to be very comfortable. We were there for a conference and it appeared to us that it caters to this type of event.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in Indian Wells

reviews.text: The location in Indian Wells, just off the 111 highway, makes it easy to access all desert hot spots such as El Paseo, casinos, Palm Springs, great restaurants and bike and walking trails.

reviews.text: Good Morning To All:
reviews.title: Marriott fan says don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just recently stayed at the Renaissance Esmeralda Resort & Spa in Indian Wells, CA from 12/02/11-12/03/11. My family and I will never ever stay at this property again. When we arrived at the valet area to check in on 12/02/11; the attendants just stared at us while we started unloading all of our luggage. Later that evening I met up with some friends that live in the area for some drinks at your bar downstairs over looking the pool. I ordered a bottle of red wine and the bartender gave me 3 spotted small wine glasses. I looked at the glasses and asked the bartender for 3 nice big cabernet glasses I saw in the near distance, and he said NO, we don't give those out because hotel guests steal them. I practically had to bag for 3 cabernet wine glasses to enjoy the $75 bottle of wine I just bought. After that my friends and I went out by the fire pit to enjoy the wine, 15 minutes later a bartender comes outside, doesn't say a word to us, and turns off the firepit. My group went inside and the male manager informed us it was a code that the firepits had to be turned off. If it was a code for the gas firepits to be turned off, why was the entire pool still being heated by gas still on. He told us we can enjoy our wine inside in the nightclub. We went inside and the nightclub attendant told us we can't take the wine in the club. It was starting to get ridiculous.... I saw another manger walk by (female w/blonde hair) and informed her of our issues and asked if I may have her business card and she said NO in a rude way and asked if I was even staying at this hotel and stormed off...... Later that morning I spoke to the female manager behind the counter at checkout and informed her of our problems with our stay and she said she would look into this, didn't even apologize................ I can not believe how poor the customer service is for a property this beautiful... I will make sure to inform all of my friends not to ever stay at this property. My local friends are doing the same and have had similar problems in the past when they have brought clients to this property.
reviews.title: Great Property and Excellent Service

reviews.text: We stopped by the Renaissance Esmeralda for one night on our Christmas Holiday drive through the Southwest.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by the excellent quality of the rooms and especially the food.
reviews.title: Very Accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 6th floor room, with two queen beds, was extremely comfortable, and had a great view over the pool and the mountains. The bathroom was suitably large, like you'd expect a Renaissance to be. The wireless internet was painfully slow, but connecting the RJ-45 cable in the room made for a speedy connection.
reviews.title: Totally Enjoyed the Esmeralda - Get a massage at the Spa!

reviews.text: The best surprise was the restaurant Cava. Our rate was a AAA "Kids eat free" rate, so we pretty much had to eat at the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised that the food was very fresh, with the salad materials locally grown (we asked - local meant from Indian Wells, within a couple miles), and the preparation delicious. And in the morning, they had a great breakfast buffet that set us well for the road (but not cheap - $22 for the full buffet, $14 for Continental).
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.text: We also were surprised that the pool was open, even though we arrived well after sundown. It was sort of freaky swimming at night, in 85 degree water with 45 degree air, surrounded by palm trees lit with brilliant blue lights. But, after a long drive, the warm swim was really welcome. At the side of the pool, they actually have a small artificial sandy beach set up - in Summer, this must be great for kids!
reviews.title: Esmeralda Excellence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very disappointed with the room we were assigned to at the Renaissance Esmeralda. We had reserved the room based on the reputation of the Renaissance chain, expecting a room that was "special". That was a mistake. Our 7th floor room had a worn, stained carpet, stained upholstered chairs, and an ugly, uncomfortable chaise lounge that was covered by a threadbare and stained fabric slipcover. The bedside lampshades had greasy stains around the rims. The small bar fridge was so battered and scratched that it looked like it had just fallen off the back of a truck. It worked, and it was convenient, but it didn't add anything to the atmosphere of the room. The only good feature of the room was the comfortable bed which appeared to be newer than the rest of the furnishings and the Aveda amenities which we appreciate.
reviews.title: Room Shabby and Worn with Stained Carpet & Furniture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the first night we went to the registration desk and requested an updated room. The desk clerk apologetically advised us that all of the rooms were furnished in the same manner as ours, and were in about the same condition. Apparently the hotel is planning to renovate all of the guest rooms about a year from now. In our opinion, the rooms should have been renovated two years ago, or the hotel rating and room charges should have been downgraded to reflect the current condition.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Renaissance Esmeralda for three nights at a charge of $250.00 per night, including taxes and fees. On two of nights the hotel was full of teenage lacrosse players and their parents. We suspected that the lacrosse teams were paying much less for their rooms, which were apparently furnished the same as ours. So we felt quite "ripped off". We felt like we were paying 4-star prices for a 2-star room in a 4-star resort.
reviews.title: Tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, all of the hotel staff we spoke to, including maintenance staff, housekeeping, and the concierge were cheerful and helpful. The housekeeping staff worked hard to keep the room and the bathroom clean in spite of the wear and tear. The hotel grounds and the pool area are beautiful, and very well maintained. The quality of the food and service in the restaurants in the Renaissance Esmeralda was outstanding.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing with a beautiful view

reviews.text: After this experience with poor room quality we would not reserve a room in a Renaissance Hotel again.
reviews.title: All round wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Esmeralda this month for a week and a half. We chose it because of quality, location and the killer deal they were offering - low price per night plus $50 resort credit per day! Anyway....like other reviewers have said - resort is beautiful! The rooms are nice - not amazing but nothing to scoff at. I found the bed to be extremely comfortable! At first I wished that there was a larger dresser for our clothes - But I called housekeeping to request more hangers and they were brought up within 10 minutes. Each time I contacted the front desk to request something (crib, hangers and laundry bags), it was brought up right away by a friendly staff member.
reviews.title: Excellent Service!!

reviews.text: The lobby is lovely with flavored water out all day every day (water with pineapple slices, strawberries or cucumbers), tons of comfy places to sit, and was decked out for the holidays. The coffee shop was great with very friendly staff - lattes were perfect and the pastries were yummy:) We ate at the sushi bar which was quick, fresh and delicious - again staff was very nice and attentive. We also ate at the main restaurant (I dont remember what its called - but its the casual one overlooking the pool). Good - not amazing - reasonably priced - very lovely to sit outside. We also had room service a couple of times which was good and quick.
reviews.title: Great hotel, poor customer service

reviews.text: The pool is amazing but it wasn't warm enough outside for us to go in:/ There were also a ton of cool outdoor seating areas with contemporary glass fire pits.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym (went once:)) is very nice with new equipment. There are complimentary earphones that plug into many of the machines which have individual tv or music options. Water and apples were also provided.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but rooms need upgrading

reviews.text: Lots of options at the Esmeralda - we would definitely stay there again:)
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds - Rooms meh
